026package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.sources;
027
028import java.util.Enumeration;
029import java.util.HashSet;
030import java.util.List;
031import java.util.Set;
032
033import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext;
034import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext.ContextCheck;
035import com.ibm.streams.operator.OutputTuple;
036import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingOutput;
037import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingData.Punctuation;
038import com.ibm.streams.operator.compile.OperatorContextChecker;
039import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.OutputPortSet;
040import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.OutputPorts;
041import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.Parameter;
042import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.PrimitiveOperator;
043import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.OutputPortSet.WindowPunctuationOutputMode;
044import com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.ProcessTupleProducer;
045import com.ibm.streams.operator.state.ConsistentRegionContext;
046
047/**
048 * Sample source operator using a {@code process()} method.
049 * Operator that reads the Java System property set
050 * and submits an output tuple for each system property.
051 * A single output port is assumed with attributes
052 * {@code name} for the property name,
053 * {@code value} for its value and
054 * {@code tags} for a set of tags set from parameters.
055 * <P>
056 * The class handles two parameters to provide a simple tagging scheme.
057 * This is used to demonstrate parameter handling.
058 * <BR>
059 * If the parameter <code>tagged</code> is set then any tuple for
060 * a system property that starts with <code>tagged</code>'s value will
061 * have its <code>tags</code> attribute set to the value of the
062 * <code>tags</code> parameter.
063 * </P>
064 * <P>
065 * The parameter <code>initDelay</code> is inherited from
066 * the parent class TupleProducer.
067 * </P>
068 * <P>
069 * This operator provided as the sample Java primitive operator
070 * <BR>
071 * {@code com.ibm.streams.javaprimitivesamples.sources.SystemPropertySource}
072 * <BR>
073 * in the sample {@code JavaOperators} toolkit located in:
074 * <BR>
075 * {@code $STREAMS_INSTALL/samples/spl/feature/JavaOperators}
076 * </P>
077 * 
078 * @see com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.TupleProducer
079 */
080@PrimitiveOperator(description="Submits an output tuple for each Java system property.",
081        comment=SystemPropertySource.IBM_Teracloud_ApS_COPYRIGHT)
082@OutputPorts({@OutputPortSet(cardinality=1,windowPunctuationOutputMode=WindowPunctuationOutputMode.Generating,
083        description="Port requiring `name` and `value` attributes representing a system property. Optional `tags` attribute containing tags for the property")})
084public class SystemPropertySource extends ProcessTupleProducer {
085    
086    private String tagged;
087
088    private Set<String> tags;
089    
090    /**
091     * {@inheritDoc}
092     */
093    @Override
094    public void initialize(OperatorContext context)
095            throws Exception {
096        super.initialize(context);
097    }
098    
099    /**
100     * If parameter {@code tagged} is set then {@code tags} is required.
101     * @param checker Checker for this invocation
102     */
103    @ContextCheck
104    public static void checkTaggedParameters(OperatorContextChecker checker) {
105        checker.checkDependentParameters("tagged", "tags");
106        OperatorContext context = checker.getOperatorContext();
107        if (context.getParameterNames().contains("tagged")) {
108            checker.checkRequiredAttributes(
109                    context.getStreamingOutputs().get(0), "tags");
110        }
111    }
112    
113    /**
114     * Check the output attributes name and value are present.
115     */
116    @ContextCheck
117    public static void checkOuputAttributes(OperatorContextChecker checker) {
118        OperatorContext context = checker.getOperatorContext();
119        checker.checkRequiredAttributes(
120                context.getStreamingOutputs().get(0), "name", "value");
121    }
122    
123    /**
124     * Set the tagged parameter.
125     * @param tagged Prefix indicated tagged system properties.
126     */
127    @Parameter(optional=true, description="Prefix for property names to be tagged with the value of `tags`.")
128    public void setTagged(String tagged) {
129        this.tagged = tagged;
130    }
131    
132    /**
133     * Set the tags parameter.
134     * @param tags Tags to be associated with tagged properties.
135     */
136    @Parameter(optional=true,
137            description="Tags to set in `tags` output attribute when the property name starts with the value of `taggged`.")
138    public void setTags(List<String> tags) {
139        this.tags = new HashSet<String>(tags);
140    }
141    
142    @Override
143    protected void process() throws Exception {
144        
145        final ConsistentRegionContext crc =
146                getOperatorContext().getOptionalContext(ConsistentRegionContext.class);
147        
148        // makeConsistent requires a permit is held.
149        if (crc != null)
150            crc.acquirePermit();
151        
152        while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
153
154            getPropertiesAndSubmit();
155            if (crc == null) {
156                // Finite set of properties so send a final mark.
157                getOutput(0).punctuate(Punctuation.FINAL_MARKER);
158                break;
159            } else {
160                // Make the region consistent.
161                if (crc.makeConsistent()) {
162                    break;
163                }
164                // else resubmit the tuples by continuing the while statement.
165            }
166        }
167        if (crc != null)
168            crc.releasePermit();
169    }
170    
171    /**
172     * Iterate over all the system properties submitting
173     * a tuple for each name value pair.
174     */
175    protected void getPropertiesAndSubmit() throws Exception {
176        
177        final StreamingOutput<OutputTuple> out = getOutput(0);
178        for (Enumeration<?> e = System.getProperties().propertyNames();
179            e.hasMoreElements(); )
180        {
181            String name = (String) e.nextElement();
182            String value = System.getProperty(name);
183            
184            OutputTuple tuple = out.newTuple();
185            
186            tuple.setString("name", name);
187            tuple.setString("value", value);
188            
189            // Add the simple tagging in, if set.
190            if (tagged != null) {
191                if (name.startsWith(tagged))
192                    tuple.setSet("tags", tags);
193            }
194            
195            out.submit(tuple);
196        }
197        
198        // Make the set of tuples a window.
199        out.punctuate(Punctuation.WINDOW_MARKER);
200    }
201}
